description: Flowchart illustrating the calculation of nΔP based on O/C. The process starts with 현재 S.L. and SP1단 S.L., leading to 공간부피 계산. This feeds into 공간부피 and 작업정보 (SO/R 등). 공간부피 leads to 1Ch 장입물 부피 계산, which leads to 1Ch 장입물 중량 and 필요 Ch수. 1Ch 장입물 중량 leads to 전체 장입물 중량 계산. 전체 장입물 중량 계산 leads to 장입물 중량 and 평균 단면적, which then leads to 장입물 압력 계산. Finally, 장입물 압력 계산 leads to O/C에 따른 nΔP 계산.

description: Line graph showing Coke size less than 6.3 mm in percent versus distance from tuyere tip in cm. The X-axis ranges from 0 to 500 cm. The Y-axis ranges from 0 to 50%. The graph illustrates three conditions: With coal (166 kg/t HM), With coal (120 kg/t HM), and Without coal. The 'Raceway' region (up to 125 cm) shows low coke size (< 15%). The 'Transition zone' (125 cm to 230 cm) shows increasing coke size, with the 'Without coal' condition having the highest increase (reaching around 30% at 200 cm). The 'Dead man' region (beyond 230 cm) shows stable coke size (around 30-35%).

section_path: 4. 조업기준 / 4.1 감산조업 수준 결정 / 가. 내용적이 3500 m³ 이하인 고로의 감산조업 Level 은 일반적으로 출선비 1.55 T/D/m³ 수준 이상을 유지해야 하나, 장기 노화 불안정을 예방하기 위하여 출선비 1.70 T/D/m³ 이상으로 실시(대폭적인 감산조업시 노심 Coke 불활성화,노벽 부착물 형성등에 의한 장기노화 불안정 초래)나. 내용적이 3500 m³ 이상인 고로는 송풍 에너지 저하에 의한 노심부 불활성화 영향이 소형고로에 비해 크므로 출선비 1.70 T/D/m³ 이상을 유지해야 하나, 장기 노화 불안정을 예방하기 위하여 출선비 1.80 T/D/m³ 이상으로 실시다. 고로 내용적 크기에 따른 고로 가동율 관리의 한계치는 일반적으로 3500 m³ 이하 고로의 경우 94% 수준을 유지하고, 3500 m³ 이상의 대형고로는 95% 이상으로 유지라. 대폭적인 감산여건 발생시에는 고로별로 번갈아 휴풍을 실시하고 나머지 고로는 최저 출선비 유지마. 휴풍에 의한 감산의 한계

description: Figure 4 shows the conical shape of a hopper with labels '소립' (small particles) and '대립' (large particles). Five numbered stages illustrate the progressive flow of material from the center towards the walls. Below the hopper diagram is a graph plotting '입도 (양)' (grain size (quantity)) and '배출량' (discharge amount) against '배출시간' (discharge time). The graph shows two curves crossing, indicating that as discharge time increases, the average grain size increases due to preferential discharge of smaller particles from the center.

description: A ternary phase diagram (triangle plot) showing the distribution of three components (중간류, 중심류, and the third component implied by the axes) in percentages. Data points are plotted: open circles (○) represent the stable state (노황안정 상태), and filled circles (●) represent the unstable state (노황불안정 상태). Two regions are highlighted: Region A (lower right) and Region B (upper left).

description: Line graph showing Top Gas Comp (%) versus 경과시간 (Elapsed Time) for K-2BF, K-3BF, and K-4BF. The X-axis ranges from 1 to 25. The Y-axis ranges from 0 to 40. K-2BF (X marks) generally shows the highest Top Gas Comp, followed by K-3BF (O marks) and K-4BF (□ marks). All curves show fluctuating trends over time, with K-2BF and K-3BF generally increasing or fluctuating higher than K-4BF, especially after 10 units of elapsed time.

description: Flowchart illustrating the cooling process and management. The flow starts with 연소용 Air Fan, moving to 측열실 Checker 수금물, then to 측열실. From 측열실, the flow splits: one path goes to 연락관, and the other path goes to 연소실. 연소실 feeds into 흡냉실, which feeds into 방산변. The second path from 연락관 also feeds into 연소실. Finally, the flow from 연소실 also goes to 방산변.
section_path: 4. 조업 기준 (열풍로 보수작업) / 4.2 외연식 열풍로 보수작업 / 4.2.1 냉각 Flow 및 냉각관리

description: Schematic diagram of the Air Cooling Flow for the Heat Exchanger (HE) 2. The flow starts from the Dome T/C, goes through a large chamber containing the 대기방산 (Air Exhaust) and 방풍관 T/C (Air Duct T/C) with Silica T/C. The flow then passes through various valves (CBMCV, HBV, BAV, ACV, GC, BGV, GPV, CHV1, CHV2, CBV, CBCV, EV) and sensors (T/C, Checkers, Flange, RV, R50A, 유량계 (Flow Meter), 수동변 (Manual Valve)). The cooled air exits via the Air 가배관 (Air Distribution Pipe) leading to CAF (Cooling Air Fan).
section_path: 4. 조업 기준 (열풍로 보수작업) / 4.2 외연식 열풍로 보수작업 / 4.2.1 냉각 Flow 및 냉각관리

description: P3R2 Cooling Plan graph showing the cooling curve of Dome temperature (℃) over 25 days. The Y-axis is labeled 'DOME 온도 (℃)' and the X-axis is '일'. The curve starts at 1000℃ on Day 1 and decreases to 0℃ by Day 25. The cooling rate changes: 1000~600℃ (4.16℃/Hr) from Day 1 to approximately Day 5, 600~258℃ (1.58℃/Hr) from approximately Day 5 to Day 15, and 258~54℃ (0.7℃/Hr) from Day 15 to Day 25. A horizontal line indicates the P3R2 Cooling Plan target temperature.
section_path: 4. 조업 기준 (열풍로 보수작업) / 4.2 외연식 열풍로 보수작업 / 4.2.1 냉각 Flow 및 냉각관리

description: Flow diagram illustrating the Cold Blast and Hot Blast system. Cold Blast air enters the top and flows into the Cold Blast chamber. It passes through valves 3, 2, and 4, and then into the Cold Chamber (촉열실). Waste Gas exits via valve 5. The Cold Chamber connects to the Hot Chamber (연소실) via valve 6. The Hot Chamber connects to the Hot Blast system via valve 7. The Hot Blast system includes the Hot Chamber (연소실), valve 8, and valve 9. The Hot Blast air exits the bottom. The diagram shows the flow path for Cold Blast and Hot Blast air, along with various valves and chambers.

description: A graph showing the temperature (Dome) versus time (hours). The X-axis is 시간 (hours) from 0 to 28. The Y-axis is D o m e, ranging from 0 to 1,200. The curve illustrates a slow heating process. Key temperature points are marked: 25°C and 55°C at the start (around 4 hours), 272°C (around 12 hours), 702°C (around 22 hours), and 1,086°C (around 26 hours). The curve is steeply increasing towards the end.

description: Flow diagram illustrating the heating (승온) process. COG (Gas) enters the system. Air (1차 Air 350A, 2차 Air 650A) is supplied to the burner (연소). The flow passes through Dome T/C, Silica T/C, and a Checker. The process moves to the furnace (측열실) and then through Dome connection pipes (연락관) to the chimney (연돌). Various valves (CBMV, HBV, BAV, EV, CHV1, RV) and temperature/flow controls (T/C, 80A, 250A) are shown along the flow path.

description: Diagram showing the reverse flow process. The main components include a furnace (M/H) with a checker (Checker 수금물) below, and flue gas ducts leading to a heat recovery section (연소실, 촉열실, 흡열실). Valves (BAV, ACV, HBV) control the flow. The exhaust gases pass through a C.A.F (Catalytic Afterburner/Furnace) and then through a fan (방산관).

description: Graph showing the change in volume percentage (%) versus temperature (°C) for various phases during the transformation of quartz. The Y-axis ranges from 0.2 to 2.2, and the X-axis ranges from 100 to 1000 °C. The curves show the following behaviors: Cristobalite (open circles) exhibits a sharp increase in volume starting around 500 °C, reaching approximately 2.0%. Tridymite (filled circles) shows a gradual increase, peaking around 600 °C at approximately 0.9%. The lines labeled '석영 C-축 수직' (Quartz C-axis vertical) and '석영 C-축 수평' (Quartz C-axis horizontal) show a sharp increase starting around 400 °C, reaching approximately 0.5% and 0.4% respectively.

description: Graph showing the change in volume percentage (%) versus temperature (°C) for three types of quartz-based refractory materials. The Y-axis ranges from 0.2 to 1.6, and the X-axis ranges from 200 to 1400 °C. The curves show: 규석연와 (Quartz refractory, solid line) exhibits a sharp increase in volume starting around 400 °C, reaching approximately 1.4%. H-AL 연와 (H-AL refractory, dashed line) shows a gradual increase, reaching approximately 0.8%. 정토연 (Zirconia refractory, dotted line) shows the lowest volume change, increasing gradually to approximately 0.6%.
